title: Electrical Engineering (EE)
description: Comprehensive GATE Electrical Engineering assessment covering General Aptitude and Core Electrical Engineering subjects. This assessment includes 10 aptitude questions (15% weight) and 55 core electrical engineering questions (85% weight) following the official GATE pattern.
whatIsDescription: GATE (Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering) Electrical Engineering is a national-level examination that primarily tests the comprehensive understanding of various undergraduate subjects in electrical engineering and related fields. This assessment follows the official GATE pattern with General Aptitude and Core Electrical Engineering questions.

typicalCareers.title: Electrical Engineer
typicalCareers.description: Advanced electrical engineering positions in power systems, control systems, and electronics

typicalCareers.title: PhD Candidate
typicalCareers.description: Pursue higher studies in electrical engineering and related fields

typicalCareers.title: Power Systems Engineer
typicalCareers.description: Senior technical roles in power generation, transmission, and distribution

whoShouldConsider: Electrical Engineering graduates preparing for GATE
Students seeking admission to M.Tech/M.E programs in electrical engineering
Professionals looking for PSU jobs in electrical sector
Researchers in electrical engineering and related fields
idealTraits: Solid foundation in electrical engineering fundamentals
Good understanding of power systems and control theory

modules: Core Electrical Engineering Assessment (55 questions, 85 marks)

aptitude.title: General Aptitude Assessment
aptitude.description: Test your general aptitude including verbal ability, quantitative aptitude, and analytical reasoning skills. This section carries 15% weight in the total assessment.

questions.text: If the sum of two numbers is 15 and their product is 54, what are the numbers?
questions.subject: Numerical Ability
questions.explanation: Let the numbers be x and y. Given: x + y = 15 and xy = 54. Solving these equations: x = 6, y = 9.

questions.text: Complete the series: 2, 6, 12, 20, 30, ?
questions.subject: Logical Reasoning
questions.explanation: The differences between consecutive terms are 4, 6, 8, 10, 12. Next number = 30 + 12 = 42.

questions.text: A train travels 360 km at a uniform speed. If the speed had been 5 km/h more, it would have taken 1 hour less. Find the original speed.
questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude
questions.explanation: Let speed = x km/h. Time = 360/x. With increased speed: 360/(x+5) = 360/x - 1. Solving: x = 40 km/h.

questions.text: Choose the word that is most nearly opposite in meaning to VERBOSE:
questions.subject: Verbal Ability
questions.explanation: Verbose means using more words than needed. Concise means expressing much in few words, making it the opposite.

questions.text: If 20% of a number is 80, what is 75% of that number?
questions.subject: Numerical Ability
questions.explanation: Let the number be x. 0.20x = 80, so x = 400. Therefore, 75% of 400 = 0.75 × 400 = 300.

questions.text: In a class of 60 students, 30 play cricket, 25 play football, and 10 play both. How many students play neither?
questions.subject: Logical Reasoning
questions.explanation: Using set theory: Total = 60, Cricket only = 20, Football only = 15, Both = 10. Neither = 60 - (20 + 15 + 10) = 15.

questions.text: Find the next term in the sequence: 1, 4, 9, 16, 25, ?
questions.subject: Numerical Ability
questions.explanation: The sequence represents perfect squares: 1², 2², 3², 4², 5², 6² = 36.

questions.text: The ratio of ages of A and B is 3:5. After 5 years, the ratio will be 2:3. What is A's current age?
questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude
questions.explanation: Let ages be 3x and 5x. After 5 years: (3x+5)/(5x+5) = 2/3. Solving: x = 5. A's age = 3×5 = 15 years.

questions.text: Which of the following statements must be true if all cats are animals and some animals are dogs?
questions.subject: Logical Reasoning
questions.explanation: From the given statements, we cannot conclude any definite relationship between cats and dogs.

questions.text: A person invests Rs. 10,000 at 10% per annum compound interest. What will be the amount after 2 years?
questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude

core.title: Core Electrical Engineering Assessment
core.description: Comprehensive assessment of core electrical engineering subjects including Network Theory, Power Systems, Control Systems, Electrical Machines, Electronic Devices, Analog Electronics, Digital Electronics, Electromagnetics, Signals and Systems, Communication Systems, Power Electronics, and Measurements. This section carries 85% weight in the total assessment.

questions.text: The RMS value of a sinusoidal voltage of peak value 100V is:
questions.subject: Network Theory
questions.explanation: For a sinusoidal waveform, RMS value = Peak value / √2 = 100 / 1.414 = 70.7V.

questions.text: In a three-phase balanced system with line voltage 400V, the phase voltage is:
questions.subject: Power Systems
questions.explanation: In a star-connected system, Phase voltage = Line voltage / √3 = 400 / 1.732 = 231V.

questions.text: The Laplace transform of unit step function u(t) is:
questions.subject: Control Systems
questions.explanation: The Laplace transform of unit step function u(t) is L{u(t)} = 1/s for s > 0.

questions.text: A DC motor develops a torque of 20 Nm at 1500 rpm. The power developed is approximately:
questions.subject: Electrical Machines

questions.text: The intrinsic impedance of free space is:
questions.subject: Electromagnetics
questions.explanation: Intrinsic impedance of free space η₀ = √(μ₀/ε₀) = 120π ≈ 377 Ω.

questions.text: In a MOSFET, the channel is formed by:
questions.subject: Electronic Devices
questions.explanation: In a MOSFET, the channel is formed by minority carriers through inversion when gate voltage exceeds threshold.

questions.text: The per-unit impedance of a transformer is 0.05 pu on its rating. On a base 10 times its rating, the pu impedance will be:
questions.subject: Power Systems
questions.explanation: When base is changed by factor k, new pu impedance = old pu impedance × (k)² / k = 0.05 × 10 = 0.5 pu.

questions.text: The Nyquist stability criterion is used to determine:
questions.subject: Control Systems
questions.explanation: Nyquist criterion determines both absolute stability (whether system is stable) and relative stability (degree of stability).

questions.text: The efficiency of a transformer is maximum when:
questions.subject: Electrical Machines
questions.explanation: Maximum efficiency occurs when variable losses (copper losses) equal constant losses (iron losses).

questions.text: The sampling theorem states that a signal can be reconstructed if sampled at a rate:

options.text: Equal to twice the highest frequency
Equal to half the highest frequency

questions.subject: Signals and Systems
questions.explanation: Nyquist-Shannon sampling theorem: Sampling rate must be at least twice the highest frequency component (fs ≥ 2fm).

questions.text: A CMOS inverter has VDD = 5V. The logic threshold voltage VTH is approximately:
questions.subject: Digital Electronics
questions.explanation: For a symmetric CMOS inverter, logic threshold VTH = VDD/2 = 5/2 = 2.5V.

questions.text: The unit of electric field intensity is:
questions.subject: Electromagnetics
questions.explanation: Electric field intensity E = V/d, where V is voltage and d is distance. Unit is Volt per meter (V/m).

questions.text: In a synchronous generator, hunting is caused by:
questions.subject: Electrical Machines
questions.explanation: Hunting (oscillation of rotor) can be caused by sudden load changes, speed variations, or excitation variations.

questions.text: The Z-transform of x[n] = aⁿu[n] is:
questions.subject: Signals and Systems
questions.explanation: Z-transform of aⁿu[n] = Σ(aⁿz⁻ⁿ) = z/(z-a) for |z| > |a|.

questions.text: The breakdown mechanism in a lightly doped p-n junction is primarily:
questions.subject: Electronic Devices
questions.explanation: In lightly doped junctions with wide depletion region, avalanche breakdown (impact ionization) dominates.

questions.text: In a transmission line, characteristic impedance Z₀ depends on:
questions.subject: Electromagnetics
questions.explanation: Characteristic impedance Z₀ = √[(R + jωL)/(G + jωC)] depends on per-unit-length parameters L, C, R, G.

questions.text: The cut-off frequency of a first-order RC low-pass filter with R = 1kΩ and C = 1μF is:
questions.subject: Analog Electronics
questions.explanation: Cut-off frequency fc = 1/(2πRC) = 1/(2π × 1000 × 1×10⁻⁶) = 159.15 Hz.

questions.text: The steady-state error for a unit step input to a Type-1 system is:
questions.subject: Control Systems
questions.explanation: Type-1 system has one integrator. For step input, steady-state error ess = 1/(1+Kp) = 0 (since Kp = ∞).

questions.text: In a three-phase induction motor, the direction of rotation can be reversed by:
questions.subject: Electrical Machines
questions.explanation: Reversing the phase sequence by interchanging any two supply lines reverses the direction of rotating magnetic field.

questions.text: The bandwidth of an FM signal with modulation index β and maximum frequency fm is approximately:
questions.subject: Communication Systems
questions.explanation: Carson's rule: Bandwidth ≈ 2(Δf + fm) = 2(βfm + fm) = 2fm(β + 1).

questions.text: The voltage regulation of a transformer is defined as:

options.text: Change in secondary voltage from no-load to full-load
Change in primary voltage from no-load to full-load
Ratio of voltage drops to rated voltage
Percentage change in secondary terminal voltage

questions.subject: Electrical Machines
questions.explanation: Voltage regulation = [(V_no-load - V_full-load) / V_full-load] × 100%. It represents percentage change in terminal voltage.

questions.text: A Buck converter operates with input voltage 24V and output voltage 12V. The duty cycle is:
questions.subject: Power Electronics
questions.explanation: For Buck converter: V_out = D × V_in. Therefore, D = V_out/V_in = 12/24 = 0.5.

questions.text: The advantage of HVDC transmission over HVAC is:
questions.subject: Power Systems
questions.explanation: HVDC transmission eliminates reactive power issues, has no skin effect, and is economical for long distances despite higher converter costs.

questions.text: The h-parameter that represents output admittance in common emitter configuration is:
questions.subject: Analog Electronics
questions.explanation: h_oe is the output admittance in CE configuration, measured as ΔI_c/ΔV_ce with I_b constant.

questions.text: In a Wheatstone bridge, maximum sensitivity occurs when:
questions.subject: Measurements
questions.explanation: Maximum sensitivity in Wheatstone bridge occurs when all four arms have equal resistance, giving maximum voltage gradient.

questions.text: The slip of a 6-pole, 50 Hz induction motor running at 960 rpm is:
questions.subject: Electrical Machines
questions.explanation: Synchronous speed N_s = 120f/P = 120×50/6 = 1000 rpm. Slip s = (N_s - N_r)/N_s = (1000-960)/1000 = 0.04.

questions.text: A single-phase half-wave rectifier with resistive load has average output voltage (V_m is peak voltage):
questions.subject: Power Electronics
questions.explanation: For half-wave rectifier: V_avg = V_m/π. The output is positive half of sine wave only.

questions.text: The forward path transfer function of a unity feedback system is G(s) = K/s(s+2). For the system to be stable, K must be:
questions.subject: Control Systems
questions.explanation: Characteristic equation: s² + 2s + K = 0. By Routh-Hurwitz criterion, for stability: K > 0 and all coefficients positive.

questions.text: The number of flip-flops required to construct a MOD-16 counter is:
questions.subject: Digital Electronics
questions.explanation: MOD-N counter requires n flip-flops where 2^n ≥ N. For MOD-16: 2^4 = 16, so 4 flip-flops needed.

questions.text: The active power consumed by a purely inductive circuit is:
questions.subject: Network Theory
questions.explanation: In purely inductive circuit, current lags voltage by 90°. Real power P = VI cos(90°) = 0.

questions.text: The equivalent circuit of a crystal oscillator represents it as:
questions.subject: Analog Electronics
questions.explanation: Crystal has series resonance (L_s, C_s, R_s) and parallel resonance (C_p), giving two resonant frequencies.

questions.text: String efficiency of a suspension insulator can be improved by:
questions.subject: Power Systems
questions.explanation: String efficiency is improved by guard rings (equalizing voltage distribution) and grading (varying capacitance).

questions.text: The condition for maximum power transfer in AC circuits is:
questions.subject: Network Theory
questions.explanation: For maximum power transfer in AC circuits: Load impedance Z_L must equal complex conjugate of source impedance Z_s*.

questions.text: A Hall effect sensor primarily measures:
questions.subject: Measurements
questions.explanation: Hall effect sensor measures magnetic field intensity by detecting voltage perpendicular to current flow in magnetic field.

questions.text: The back emf in a DC motor is directly proportional to:
questions.subject: Electrical Machines
questions.explanation: Back emf E_b = (PφZN)/(60A) ∝ φN, where φ is flux and N is speed. It's proportional to both flux and speed.

questions.text: The Bode plot of a system shows a slope of -40 dB/decade. The system has:

options.text: One pole and one zero at origin

questions.subject: Control Systems
questions.explanation: Slope of -40 dB/decade indicates two poles at origin (each pole at origin contributes -20 dB/decade).

questions.text: In a 3-phase bridge inverter, the number of switching devices required is:
questions.subject: Power Electronics
questions.explanation: A 3-phase bridge inverter requires 6 switching devices (2 per phase) to generate 3-phase AC output from DC input.

questions.text: The propagation constant of a transmission line is given by:
questions.subject: Electromagnetics
questions.explanation: Propagation constant γ = α + jβ, where α is attenuation constant (Np/m) and β is phase constant (rad/m).

questions.text: A Karnaugh map for 4 variables has how many cells?
questions.subject: Digital Electronics
questions.explanation: K-map for n variables has 2^n cells. For 4 variables: 2^4 = 16 cells arranged in 4×4 grid.

questions.text: The load angle of a synchronous motor at no-load is:
questions.subject: Electrical Machines
questions.explanation: At no-load, synchronous motor has zero load angle as there's no torque requirement and rotor is aligned with stator field.

questions.text: The main advantage of using negative feedback in amplifiers is:
questions.subject: Analog Electronics
questions.explanation: Negative feedback improves stability, reduces distortion, increases bandwidth, and makes gain independent of transistor parameters.

questions.text: Ferranti effect in transmission lines causes:
questions.subject: Power Systems
questions.explanation: Ferranti effect occurs in lightly loaded long lines where capacitance dominates, causing receiving end voltage > sending end voltage.

questions.text: The impulse response of an LTI system is h(t) = e^(-2t)u(t). The system is:
questions.subject: Signals and Systems
questions.explanation: System is causal (h(t)=0 for t<0 due to u(t)) and stable (∫|h(t)|dt converges as e^(-2t) decays).

questions.text: The main function of a commutator in a DC machine is to:

options.text: Convert AC to DC in generator
Convert DC to AC in motor

questions.subject: Electrical Machines
questions.explanation: Commutator performs mechanical rectification: converts AC to DC in generator, DC to AC in armature, ensures unidirectional torque.

questions.text: The gain margin of a system with open-loop transfer function G(s)H(s) = K/[s(s+1)(s+2)] for K=6 is:
questions.subject: Control Systems
questions.explanation: System has 3 poles, no zeros. Phase never reaches -180°, so phase crossover frequency doesn't exist. Gain margin is infinite.

questions.text: In amplitude modulation, if modulation index is 0.5 and carrier power is 100W, the total power is:
questions.subject: Communication Systems

questions.text: A CT is rated 500/5A, 50VA, 5P10. The accuracy class is:
questions.subject: Measurements
questions.explanation: 5P10 indicates accuracy class 5P (5% composite error at 10 times rated current), used for protection applications.

questions.text: The forbidden energy gap in silicon at 300K is approximately:
questions.subject: Electronic Devices
questions.explanation: Silicon has energy gap E_g ≈ 1.1 eV at room temperature (300K). Germanium has ~0.7 eV, GaAs has ~1.4 eV.

questions.text: The magnitude of pointing vector represents:
questions.subject: Electromagnetics
questions.explanation: Poynting vector P = E × H represents electromagnetic power flow density (W/m²) in the direction of propagation.

questions.text: The maximum efficiency of a class B push-pull amplifier is:
questions.subject: Analog Electronics
questions.explanation: Class B amplifier has theoretical maximum efficiency η_max = π/4 = 78.5%, better than Class A (50%) but with crossover distortion.

questions.text: A 3-phase alternator has 4 poles and runs at 1500 rpm. The frequency of generated voltage is:
questions.subject: Electrical Machines
questions.explanation: Frequency f = PN/120 = 4 × 1500/120 = 50 Hz.

questions.text: The critical resistance of a DC shunt generator is the resistance of:
questions.subject: Electrical Machines
questions.explanation: Critical resistance is the maximum field circuit resistance below which generator will build up voltage at a given speed.

questions.text: The power factor of an RLC series circuit at resonance is:
questions.subject: Network Theory
questions.explanation: At resonance, X_L = X_C, so impedance Z = R (purely resistive). Power factor = cos(0°) = 1 (unity).

questions.text: A differentiator circuit using op-amp has input impedance that:
questions.subject: Analog Electronics
questions.explanation: Input impedance Z_in = 1/(jωC) decreases with increasing frequency, making circuit susceptible to high-frequency noise.

questions.text: The advantage of pulse width modulation (PWM) in inverters is:
questions.subject: Power Electronics
questions.explanation: PWM provides reduced harmonics, variable voltage/frequency control, and improved efficiency compared to square-wave operation.

results.title: GATE Electrical Engineering Assessment Results
results.description: Your comprehensive GATE Electrical Engineering assessment results with detailed analysis and recommendations for improvement.
